titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Nov. 1: a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Nov. 1
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This document is the excerpt of the Monday November 1, 1824 session of court, during which several cases were heard. One of the cases involves Lewis Ross, who brought suit against two other men for harboring one of his slaves. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: Monday 1 of November
div1.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment, Present their Honors

Cherokee Nation Ptf
vs
Elisha Dyer Dft

Lewis Ross Ptf
vs
Richard & John Ratliff Dfts
It is the opinion of the Court that Rich and John Ratliff shall pay L. Ross $92.00

Jessee Rapier Dft
vs
John Christie Ptf

Archy Downing Ptf
vs
Archy Downing D
appeal from Hickory log to National Committee
Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock
